Eco Spds
Laden   abt 13.0 knts  on abt 27.5mt / abt 12.0kts on abt 22.5mt ifo +0.1mt mgo
Ballast  abt 13.5 knts  on abt 25.0mt / abt 12.5kts on abt 22.5mt ifo +0.1mt mgo
In Port Cons Idle abt 2.8 mt ifo + abt 0.3mt mgo /working abt 4.8 mt ifo + abt 0.5mt mgo
Vessel has the liberty to use MGO for incinerator, main engine/generator engines when manoeuvring in/out of
ports or in narrow/shallow waters, canals, rivers, in/out port, shifting of generator engine,
when ballasting / deballasting, and starting up/turning off engines.
Above speed and consumption figures are on the basis of no hull fouling during the CP, only apply on good weather
days (of a minimum 24 consecutive hours) and any of the following days are excluded from any
warranty as to the vessel’s speed and performance: those in which the weather conditions exceed
either Beaufort Force 4 and/or Douglas Sea State 3 and significant wave and swell height of 1.25m or
greater or those in which there are negative influences of swell or those in which there are
adverse currents and provided no cargo is loaded on deck.
All details “about” which is understood to mean a 0.5 knots tolerance and a 5% allowance on bunker
consumption. In the event that any speed/performance claim is made, Owners are entitled to offset
the value of any bunker savings made by Charterers below the upper limit of the warranted consumption.
Positive currents not to be considered for analysing performance.
All details "about"
PLSD TO HEAR.
BEST REGARDS,
